definition: head/chief/first (occasion, thing etc)/classifier for poems, songs etc
position/location/place/seat/classifier for people (honorific)/classifier for binary bits (e.g. 十六位 16-bit or 2 bytes)/(physics) potential

sentences.english: The wedding expenses in Shanghai are among the highest in the country.
sentences.chinese: 上海的婚嫁消費成本在全國居首位。

sentences.english: What prompted the making of Bash in the first place?
sentences.chinese: 什麼原因促使您把Bash擺在首位？

sentences.english: Was the first Asian-American to be governor of state in continental U. S.
sentences.chinese: 他是美籍華人在美國大陸的首位州長。

sentences.english: To be updated is of utmost priority in today's knowledge-driven society.
sentences.chinese: 在當今這樣知識驅動的社會，適應是排在首位的。

sentences.english: According to The Tribune, Gunnell topped the list for the third straight year.
sentences.chinese: 根據這份名單，古納爾已是第三年位居名單首位了。

sentences.english: At the head of the table is Governor Tancredi.
Cell phones won, chosen by 30 percent of respondents.
sentences.chinese: 成果手機名列首位，30%的答卷人的選項是手機。

sentences.english: Conclusion ROP is the leading cause of blindness of students in Guangzhou Blind School.
sentences.chinese: 結論ROP是廣州市盲校學生的首位致盲眼病。

sentences.english: Let that be your guide for what you prioritize during your working hours.
sentences.chinese: 讓那在你工作時成爲你把什麼放在首位的嚮導。

sentences.english: At the second lap, Sean He regained the leading position.
sentences.chinese: 但在第二圈，何賢磊又奪回了首位。

sentences.english: Mr. Obama is the first U.S. president to chair a summit-level meeting at the council.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬是主持安理會峯會級會議的首位美國總統。

sentences.english: However, Asia needs to put collective security first for once.
sentences.chinese: 不過，這一次亞洲需要將集體安全放在首位。

sentences.english: Ms. Porat, 57, will be the first woman in Google's senior ranks .
sentences.chinese: 57歲的波拉特將是谷歌高管階層的首位女性。

sentences.english: She was the first CIO appointed for the University of North Carolina system.
sentences.chinese: 她是北卡羅萊納大學委任的首位CIO。

sentences.english: Paint-free door will become the first choice majority of home users.
sentences.chinese: 免漆門勢必成爲廣泛居日用戶的首位挑選。

sentences.english: The social factor rose to the first.
sentences.chinese: 剖宮產指徵中社會因素上升到首位。

definition: to stand above/to occupy an important position/to rank (among the top few)
second only to.../(in second place) preceded only by...
to stand side by side/to be juxtaposed
to continue in a post/(to hold a post) several times in succession/(to win a title) in successive years/to stay at number one/to defend a championship
notice or announcement/list of names/public roll of successful examinees
to rank (number 1, or third last etc)/to be among (those who are in a particular group)
to follow closely behind sb or sth (idiom)
